eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyName: A Job for a Museum Collection
storyInfo: To get the gem, Pepe has no choice but to accept Medjehtiqedti's terms, leaving Zubayr behind in the museum to draw in visitors. However, Zubayr is angered by the rude tourists, and leaves after a quarrel with Pepe. He then runs into a distraught Narantuya on the riverbank.

attributes.content: Please queue here for tickets... Please queue here for tickets to the 'Encounter with a Resurrected General from the Time of the Shah' special exhibition!
attributes.name: Museum PA

attributes.content: Please queue here for tickets, please queue here for tickets...
attributes.name: Museum PA

attributes.content: Yes, eyes on me, look at me, not the camera.
attributes.name: Fervent Crowd

attributes.content: Please wait just a moment! I need to straighten my bridal gown!
attributes.name: Fervent Crowd

attributes.content: I worked all night to make this, but I guarantee with my three thousand tales about the Shah that it is historically accurate!
attributes.name: Fervent Crowd

attributes.content: Please note flash photography is prohibited in this exhibition, to prevent damaging the cultural artifacts.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Alright! Lets do twenty burst shots!
attributes.name: Fervent Crowd

attributes.content: Hey guys, I'm finally inside the most mysterious room of the Varjavandabad Museum.
attributes.name: Visitor On Hoverboard

attributes.content: Now, I'm going to smoothly record the movements of this heroic general from all angles and uncover the secrets of the resurrection in the City of Radiance.
attributes.name: Visitor On Hoverboard

attributes.content: Dad, its legs look empty inside.
attributes.name: Young Visitor

attributes.content: You hear that, Dad? It sounds like it's empty inside when I knock on it!
attributes.name: Young Visitor

attributes.content: Mhm, yes, this batch of goods must be delivered to Higashi. It's not a large order, but we can't come off as unreliable...
attributes.name: Visitor On Phonecall

attributes.content: Sir, please look after your child.
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Sorry, hold on, I'm a little busy... Hey! Come back here! Don't run off touching everything!
attributes.name: Visitor On Phonecall

attributes.content: Please don't make noise in the museum...
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Hey, you're the ones who decided to pull off this open exhibition and even let your exhibit wander around! You didn't even limit the number of visitors, so it's no wonder the place is so rowdy!
attributes.name: Visitor On Phonecall

attributes.content: Acting Curator Anat believes that 'History and knowledge should be made equally available to all', and thus she has not established a tiered ticketing system.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Also, the sixty centimeter-high guardrails around my display are meant to prevent visitors from intruding into my space. If your child crosses the rails, you will be flouting the rules and regulations of this place.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Please cooperate with the staff...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Gah! I missed!
attributes.name: Tourist With Coins

attributes.content: This guide doesn't say which currencies work.
attributes.name: Tourist Reading Guide

attributes.content: To be fair, the guide doesn't even say if tossing a coin will bring good luck.
attributes.name: Tourist Reading Guide

attributes.content: Why not try it anyway, just in case?
attributes.name: Tourist With Coins

attributes.content: ...Give me a coin. I should aim for its torso, right?
attributes.name: Tourist Reading Guide

attributes.content: Please... stop... this is an important historical artifact...!
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: There's too many of them, I can't handle them all...
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Understood. I will use my weapon to slice the incoming projectiles apart.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: (Lifts hand)
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Arrghâ€”!
attributes.name: Visitor in Armor

attributes.content: Everyone, look!
attributes.name: Visitor in Armor

attributes.content: I'm role-playing a Nightzmoran warrior from a thousand years ago! Ack, I have been defeated! What a grand historical re-enactment!
attributes.name: Visitor in Armor

attributes.content: My weapon did not make any contact with his body.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Oh, General of the Shah! A few words for your defeated foe, perhaps!
attributes.name: Visitor in Armor

attributes.content: Back in my day, the most common phrase one would hear in the army when beheading captured enemy leaders was 'The insects shall devour your entrails'.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Okay, sure, if you could just say that again...
attributes.name: Visitor in Armor

attributes.content: Hey, hey! Don't come over while I'm still lying on the ground! You're gonna cause a stampede!
attributes.name: Visitor in Armor

attributes.content: Oh no... I should call for backup.
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Who could've guessed there would be so many people here to see a walking mummy when the Flood Festival is going on?
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Hatshepsut Hanimefendi, I hear you've been spending recent days looking for a particular gem lately.
attributes.name: Woman of High Status

attributes.content: It just so happens my family is in possession of one, so I've brought it here for you. I hope it can alleviate your worries.
attributes.name: Woman of High Status

attributes.content: Thank you so, so much... please let me see it...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I wonder if I might be fortunate enough to host you at my home for dinner sometime soon?
attributes.name: Woman of High Status

attributes.content: So sorry, hanimefendi, but I've been crazy busy lately.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Thank you for taking the trouble to bring me the gem, but I'm sorry to say it's not the one I'm looking for.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Oh, truly a pity. I will bother you no more, Hatshepsut Hanimefendi. Until we meet again.
attributes.name: Woman of High Status

attributes.content: Uh... how many more do we still have outside?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Seventy-three, and they all claim to have the gem you're looking for.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Why are there so many?!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Just tough it out and take a break at noon. Some gemstone merchants from the Grand Bazaar say they've found some clues, so we'll go over then to take a look.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You call that a break...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Of course. You'll only be seeing gemstones, no people.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Anat Hanim, the Padishah's daughter has been sitting here frowning for the past three hours. Are you still interested in the remaining gemstones?
attributes.name: Gem Merchant

attributes.content: How many do we have left?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: More than two hundred...
attributes.name: Gem Merchant

attributes.content: ...Leave them here, we'll finish looking through this crate first.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Very well, I'll take my leave then.
attributes.name: Gem Merchant

attributes.content: Anat... did someone come by earlier?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: They delivered another crate of gemstones.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Anat, something's wrong... why does your head look like a prism...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The furnishings too... they're sparkling...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe!!!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The museum has finally opened its doors?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Yes, Aspasia Hanim. The special exhibition tickets are in high demand! I heard wind of it last night and wanted to tell you to queue up early, but I couldn't find you.
attributes.name: Museum Receptionist

attributes.content: It's alright, that's not what I'm here to see. It's the collector I'm looking for.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: You seem to be in a good mood.
attributes.name: Museum Receptionist

attributes.content: As I thought, language is a bridge to peace, communication serves as a foundation of understanding, and this historic city is also abundant with knowledge.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: *sigh* Sargonians have been proud of their glorious history since antiquity. How wonderful it would be if they were willing to sit down for a long conversation, instead of plundering everywhere they go.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: That collector understood how persistent we Minoans could be, after my explanation, and I also gained much from his insights into the city...
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Right, there is something I want to ask you.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: In modern Menat-Ha'mait, are silver crafts more valuable than those made from gold?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Haha, are you joking?
attributes.name: Museum Receptionist

attributes.content: Of course, it does happen from time to time... for example, under pain of death by a lord ameer.
attributes.name: Museum Receptionist

attributes.content: ...I see, thank you for the clarification.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: May I ask if that companion of mine has returned?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Yes, with two other friends as well.
attributes.name: Museum Receptionist

attributes.content: Two other... friends?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Very well. The more heads to share ideas with, the better. I'd love to find more Kurantas as passionate and frank as she.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Aspasia walks up the hotel stairs and stops before the door.
Narantuya, are you in there?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I bring good news. That collector who won third place has decided to return my goblet to me after listening to my three-hour speech!
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Would you like to come with me to the museum to look at both goblets together...?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: ...I didn't see anyone go in or out of that room with the gemstone last night, Narantuya.
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Voice

attributes.content: I was hiding on the roof of the opposite building with my eyes peeled the entire time.
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Voice

attributes.content: ...You know how important this kidnapping is. This is the only way to quickly get a big pile of money.
attributes.name: Narantuya's Voice

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Narantuya. We'll go look for the Padishah's daughter right away.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: It's too late for that.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The caravan I got to be our cover is about to leave the city. Even if we manage to find and snatch her, we won't have a way out.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Let's focus on what to do next.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Both of you should go back to the museum, but avoid contact with the girl. Report in as soon as you find any other way to make money.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'll go look for the lost gemstone and return it to Aspasia. That's the least I can do...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You don't have to do that.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Ajazi suddenly feels a deadly silence descend upon the room.
She looks at the intruding stranger, shifts her gaze to Narantuya, and finally turns her head to Ajani with eyes pleading for help.
Ajani raises a finger to her lips with her other hand inching towards the sedative at her waist.
Uh, I can explain, Aspasia.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We were just mapping out our plan. Once it's done, I'll return you your gem, or something of equal value. You can trust me on that.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Oh, and, these are my other two subordinates...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What plan?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I heard you planning to bait the Padishah's daughter with that gem, in order to kidnap her.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: ...You heard everything?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: My apologies, I had no intention of eavesdropping on your conversation. I just happened to be standing by the door.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I believe communication lays the foundation of understanding, but I also know you have a large debt to pay and need money urgently.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: So, would you like to tell me the whole story?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: To be honest, I don't have a clue where the gem is right now. There's nothing I could ask you to do, even if you want to help.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The past is in the past, and our plan now... Well, we basically don't have one.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You know that's not what I'm talking about.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: If I tell you why I owe this debt and need the money, will you help me?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I believe we can discuss a more honest and conscientious way to do it.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Heh, I knew you'd say something like that.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Aspasia, mind holding your hand out for me?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What for?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: For old times' sake... I just want to...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Ajani and Ajazi exchange looks with each other.
They are certain Narantuya's call to action is the moment when they hear the crisp clacking of her heels on the ground.
â€”â€”Ask you for a discount on what I owe you.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Ajazi and Ajani

attributes.content: I've been staying with you for weeks and even took your gem. I have to pay you back for all that.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: This coin purse holds one thousand and two hundred dinars. I know it's not enough, but... I mean, we're such good friends, aren't we?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya...
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Ah, there's a bunch of foreign coins in there too. Some merchants might not recognize them, but I'm sure you'll find somewhere to spend them.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Here's some gemstones too. They're tiny and impure, but they make up for it in number.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So... could you be a bit flexible with my debt?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Narantuya!
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Are you so unwilling to have an actual discussion about this with me?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: 'Communication lays the foundation of understanding', right? I already get you, though.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Maybe you spent day after day in your temple copying statues to work out the basics of swordsmanship, or maybe you followed your parents and took an oath passed down through generations.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: More importantly, you're one of the innumerable followers of the Minoan heroes, so I'm sure your soul is pure.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You'd definitely help out someone about to fall from a tall building, and you'd speak up to anyone who used more... exceptional methods.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Yes, you're right.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I believe a scale of good and evil lies within all our hearts, and one exists within the laws of the land as well. People ought to act according to the balance of that scale.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: But I understand your point of view. Perhaps you would say the laws set by the lords ameer and padishahs are of abnormal balance, and one should act as one's heart dictates.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: However... I dare not trust myself, Narantuya.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: If the day does come when I'm caught by the lords ameer and they give me some ridiculous death sentence, will you feel sorry for me?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Hah. That's all I need. Looks like you think my death would be a great loss for all Sargon too.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Your help in my grand project would significantly lessen the risk of us failing midway. But I understand if you don't want to.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: People come and go. I'd love to have everyone join me and stay by my side, but if I care too much about those who leave, aren't I just as stupid as the ones who resent me?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What I mean is... let's not make it difficult for each other.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Very well.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I consider your debt settled.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You're injured.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I'm fine, it's just a scratch...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You should see to it. I've met many a warrior who lost his life after neglecting a minor injury.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Times have changed... I'll tell you all about modern medical science someday.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Are you going to rest?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: No... I need to tidy up these soaked notes first...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Soaked?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: It's a super long story, and I don't know if I'm sane enough right now to tell you the whole thing.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Before we parted this morning, you promised to share the information you obtained with me. Stay true to your word, Pepe.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: ...Okay, I found absolutely nothing today.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I made an announcement, and lots of people came to see me with similar-looking gems, but they were all useless stones.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I spent the whole day watching gem after gem fly past my eyes until my head was spinning. Then I went to get a drink and take a break, but the two kids next to me suddenly started fighting.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: They knocked over the table and my drink, spilling it onto my notebook, and that's how I got this bruise...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: That's all I have to share with you, Zubayr.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Got the information you needed from that?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Do you... wish to hear what I experienced today?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Zubayr...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Many strange people came... though they were rather amusing as well.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Let's pick this back up tomorrow. You don't need to sleep, but I'm exhausted.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe... I do not wish to stay inside the museum.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Just bear with it for a few more days... we need to help Titi with her exhibition until its over. That's how we got the gem from her, after all.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Once the exhibition is over, I'll take you to look for the other gemstones.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I do not want to look for gemstones either...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: What's wrong, Zubayr? As the guardian of the Shah's treasury, aren't you supposed to recover all your memories and resume your original duties?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Are you not the one more eager to locate the treasury?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Ah... yeah, you're right. I mean why else did you think I woke you up?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe. I am already awake, and you can no longer treat me as a mere artifact. My thoughts and actions are my own to control.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I do not wish to recall all my memories so soon. At least for the moment.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Tomorrow we will have fine weather, and I wish to take a walk outside, free of all worry.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: People are going to freak out if they see a museum exhibit getting some sun all alone on the streets!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I already told you, I am not an exhibiting artifact!
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Zubayr...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: It's fine.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: It's already so late though, and I'm REALLY tired, so... we can talk tomorrow, okay?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Good night.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: In the empty room, Zubayr tries to press the wall switch and turns the light off.
After a moment, he tries again, and the light comes back on.
Meow?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Mio stands in the middle of a night-shrouded street, staring at a window in the distance with a light repeatedly flickering on and off.
And thenâ€”
The light stops flickering, and glass shatters.
Once the south wind passes, it'll be the drought season over there.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Will I manage to make enough money before then?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Alright, prepare to jump...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Whoa!
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: Girls are really something these days... What are you doing? Throwing your life away?
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: What, isn't this normal for the Flood Festival?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I want to ask the river god some questions.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Not by jumping into the river though...
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: Also, which history book did you even learn this custom from, girlie?
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: The ancients did ask the river for answers when they were unsure of something, but later, they realized many problems could be solved with money...
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: Thanks, but that life hack won't work for me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I can answer your question, though.
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: The lamplighter raises his lamp and approaches Narantuya.
Before the southern wind blows through, you won't have enough money to satisfy your own desires, but it will be what you need.
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: ...I'll rephrase my question and be more specific: where should I go to look for the money?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: To the depths of the sands.
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: This is Sargon, that doesn't do much to narrow it down.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I can only answer one more question.
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: I thought the people of Menat-Ha'mait were generous sorts with unlimited samples to offer?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: No... wait, that's not the question I wanted to ask.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I want to know... will that rigid Minoan come looking for me?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Lamplighter

attributes.content: As soon as the lamplighter finishes, Narantuya catches a glimpse of a shadow on the edge of her vision.
The figure stops in the empty street and looks at her for a moment before turning and leaving.
...Aspasia?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Aspasia!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The shadow crosses the street, and the crimson Kuranta chases after it.
Narantuya can only hear the sound of the wind, the rush of the river, and a song from the lamplighter that gradually fades into silence.

attributes.text: â™ªMay I see Him by the waterside, may I follow Him to eternityâ™ª

attributes.content: ...I lost sight of her?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I, Narantuya, actually lost track of a target? Must have been a ghost.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Forget it, I'm not stupid.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Everyone here is always praying to see a spirit or two, and I heard no footsteps earlier.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So, this only means I really did see a ghost, yes?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: She sits down on the curb.
On the other side of a flowerbed sits someone listening to the river silently in the dark.
The benches by the river tend to get wet, you might want to wipe it dry first.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You're not actually scared of ghosts, are you?
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: What, did you see that shadow too? Did it spook you? Need me to protect you?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...I'm feeling nostalgic.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: I didn't get a good look, but I'm certain it felt like the soul of a late friend or kin.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: Two spotting a ghost is always better than just one.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I hear anyone who spots that shadow will receive the blessing of Menat-Ha'mait, but it looks like the two of us here are down on luck.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...I merely got into an argument.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: What a coincidence. I'm guessing you didn't win?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I would not be sitting here if I did.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: Haha.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: You know what? Somebody told me ten minutes ago that the locals are never troubled because money can always solve their problems.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I thought that made sense. What's there to be sad about, if you're not as desitute as me?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Today, someone threw something at me, another soiled the new cape I got last week, and I was inexplicably married twenty times to people of all genders and ages.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: No one was interested in listening to me either.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: O-Oh... that's pretty unlucky.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: How old are you? They stole your identity for a marriage registration?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: Your voice is a little strange, but you sound young. No offense.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: *sigh* I think I was pretty lucky, when I was around your age.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: One time, we were herding some stolen burdenbeasts back home, and the sky suddenly turned dark. Our headscarves couldn't shield us from the sand flying our way.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: But we had plenty of manpower, and quickly found a somewhat different area to dig into.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Guess what we found? Two houses buried in the sand, just enough to fit everyone. Even came with beds and tables.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Common furnishing you find in ancient tombs.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: Hahaha! You know your stuff! I only found out a few years later.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Those were wonderful days.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Indeed... Time can alter how rivers flow, establish and eradicate cities, bleach bones with the sun, elongate and intensify history.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: It makes one miss the past, and nostalgia... can be a fearsome thing.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: Yeah. Miss the past all you want, but you're never getting it back.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: How are the people you've been missing?
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: They're alive, but more surviving than living.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The worst part is that they can't just move on. You have no idea how many of them sold off their blades.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So as their boss, I owe them.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I mean, I just need to build a new pile of gold, and those stooges will cheer up and return to the way they used to be.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I hope that is the case.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I... don't know either.
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: It's like how people risk their lives to catch a glimpse of the river god, but all they end up seeing is the last face they would ever want to see. Is that not a terrifying prospect?
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: It's not that scary, if people still choose to chase that mirage.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Well, that's what my mother always told me, back home:
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: 'We Nightzmora must be the masters of fear, and will never be dominated by it.' That's what they all say.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: â€”You're a Nightzmora?
attributes.name: Lost Passerby?

attributes.content: Yeah, whyâ€”
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Narantuya feels a pat on her shoulder and turns her head on reflex.
She sees no one but the silent street, with its lamps being lit one by one from a distance.
The lamplighter hums a tune as he walks up to them, climbing up a ladder and opening the glass shade to light it.
AAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Help, HELP! There's a dead guy haunting meee!!!
attributes.name: Narantuya
